ws.rocket.path.annotation

Class RootNodeProducer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ws.rocket.path.annotation.RootNodeProducer

  • public final class RootNodeProducer
extends Object
    CDI (Contexts And Dependency Injection) producer creating root TreeNodes.

    A field or method wishing for a tree to be constructed, must use Inject and RootNode annotations where tree injection must be done. For example: 

     @Inject
 @RootNode
 private TreeNode hierarchy;

    This producer uses meta information from the @RootNode annotation for looking up the value object of the root node. After that, the producer uses TreeNode annotation on the value objects for determining the key value and child-nodes of the current node. When a value object implements TreeNodeBuilder contract, its method will be used for creating child-nodes instead of the references in @TreeNode annotation.

    The algorithm follows:

    1. This producer is given an injection point with @RootNode annotation and of type TreeNode.
    2. The tree node value object is looked up (first successful lookup will become the value object):
      • by CDI bean type (from the @RootNode or @TreeNode annotation when present);
      • by CDI bean name (from the @RootNode or @TreeNode annotation when present);
      • if the injection point is class field, by CDI bean name (using field name).
    3. The key for the tree node is resolved and created (first successful result will become the key object):
      • if value object implements KeyBuilder, the value returned by its method will be used for the key;
      • CDI bean lookup by type (from the @TreeNode annotation when present);
      • CDI bean lookup by name (from the @TreeNode annotation when present);
      • default to null.
    4. If value object implements TreeNodeBuilder, the child nodes are defined by the value object as described in the builder documentation (however, note that this approach skips CDI dependency injection).
    5. Otherwise, the child-nodes of the current tree node, when present, are resolved and created as described in steps 2-6.
    6. A tree node instance is created using the resolved key object, value object, and child-nodes.

    As can been seen from the algorithm, the tree is created starting from the leaves of the nodes, although the meta information is read starting from the root of the tree. In addition, thanks to CDI, all associated node key and value objects get their annotated dependencies injected.

    Author:
    Martti Tamm

      TreeNode createTree(InjectionPoint injectionPoint)
      Produces a tree where root TreeNode has the value object with the same name and/or type as provided in the RootNode annotation (or class field name, if injection point is a class field).

    • Constructor Detail

      • RootNodeProducer

    • Method Detail

      • createTree

        @Produces
@RootNode
public TreeNode createTree(InjectionPoint injectionPoint)
        Produces a tree where root TreeNode has the value object with the same name and/or type as provided in the RootNode annotation (or class field name, if injection point is a class field).

        Producer fails with an exception when the injection point does not declare neither root node value bean name nor type, and injection point is not a class field.

        Parameters:
        injectionPoint - The point where the tree is to be injected.
        Returns:
        The created tree.
